text: We TRACK through the living room, passing framed photos o athletic eleven year old boy, and we hear a WOMAN'S VOICE she comes down the stairs with a GOLDEN RETRIEVER at her side.
(into phone) Yes Donna, I'm out the door. We TRACK over the Woman's shoulder and follow her into th kitchen, unable to see her face.

Just inform Kayleigh that anesthesia is on the way to prep the epidural and I'll be there as soon as I can. Still looking over her shoulder, we watch her absently straighten a PHOTOGRAPH of her son on the fridge as she talks.

And promise her she's about to have a woooonnderful labor. As the woman pours herself a fresh cup of coffee, her HOUSEKEEPER enters the kitchen with a full laundry basket They give each other a silent wave.
Right, I'll see you in twenty. She hangs up her cordless and takes a breath as we COME AROUND to finally REVEAL JESSICA MARTIN; slightly weary, ready for the day ahead.
Buenas dias, Rosario.
Good morning Miss Jessica. Jessica sees her answering machine blinking, hits PLAY. In the background, a cheerful Rosario enters frame and he for the back door carrying the basket of laundry.

(on machine) Honey? Honey, wake up.   Pick up the- And as she brings the coffee cup to her lips-- SLAMM!! The door EXPLODES open and a squad of FIVE GUNMEN storm in, wearing SKI-MASKS. Everything is a whirlwind of quick cuts, noise and confusion. Jessica's DOG starts to lunge at the men and -- thup! -- stilled by a silenced pistol before its second bark. Rosario runs for the ALARM SYSTEM --
Get away from there! Don't touch that -- !! -- but as she reaches out for the PANIC BUTTON -- BLAM!! blows her away, too. The Gunman curses, then turns on Jessica.
(dire) Where is he? Jessica cringes.
Where is who?
Wrong answer. The bastard hauls back and -- WHAM I -- punches her in th face, knocking Jessica cold. Then he turns to his men.
Search the house. And as the answering machine fills the silence:
(on machine) -I'll call back later. The LEAD GUNMAN spins around, and we PUSH INTO the blackn of his masked face.

The BLACKNESS of a BLACK VAN and ESCALADE passing below u We quickly CRANE DOWN to see the vehicles traveling throu An IRON GATE at the edge of an aband9ned property. They bounce down a long lonely driveway lined with barren tree ANGLE ON: THE KIDNAPPERS' VAN as it arrives at its destination; an isolated HOUSE in the Hills. The grass is dead. The trees are dead. It's the kind of place you coul scream for a week and no one would hear a thing. As the van stops--

A door CRASHES open. Light slices through the dark reveal the dusty, skeletal interior. Jessica is hurled into the room and falls to the floor. With bound hands, she frantically pulls her blindfold off to see--
Standing in front of her.    Sturdier than the rest.   So Imposing.

Wh... what do you want? Unsettlingly, the Kidnapper says nothing, staring at her. Jessica tries to remain calm under his angry gaze... Then suddenly, the Kidnapper turns and exits the room. Jessica breathes a sigh of relief...but it catches in her throat as he returns ten seconds later -- with a BASEBALL Grim as death, he stalks toward her --
No, wait.. And reaching.her, he hauls back and SWINGS --

SMASH! The bat connects with a wooden beam an inch above Jessica's head, OBLITERATING the ROTARY DIAL TELEPHONE th hung there. As phone guts shower down on her, the Lead Kidnapper turn and stomps away, slamming the attic door shut and locking Jessica in the darkness. Only now that they're gone does Jessica allow her fear to show through. Trembling, tears running down her face, Jessica finally breaks down, pleading to the empty attic-
Wha... what the hell is happening?! The attic's suffocating silence is the only answer she ge
Skimming along the water. And we TILT UP to reveal the majestic beaches of Southern California, and at the center of it all, the SANTA MONICA PIER.

It would be a typical day, except for that some PEOPLE ar preparing for a "HEAL THE BAY" rally at the end of the pi VENDORS set up, preparing for the daily grind ahead. BIKERS gather around a bad-ass HELLCAT G2 CONFEDERATE MOTORCYCLE and admire its cutting-edge design. HOT CHICKS in bikinis try on sunglasses at a stand. FISHERMEN crack beers while awaiting the next bite.

The screen displays a car-race arcade game. A computer generated hot-rod passes other racers at breakneck speed. Playing the sit-down game, DAYTONA USA, is: RYAN ACKERMAN, early twenties, looks like he grew up on t beach without so much as a pot to piss in. His lethal reflexes and bold recklessness, however, have made him a Master of the game. Ryan's score approaches the HIGH SCORE at the top of the screen.
You recording this?

Yeah, sure... CHAD, his best bud, aims a BLUE TOOTH VIDEOSTREAMING CELLPHONE at some CUTE GIRLS instead. We can see their fa on the tiny SCREEN of the cellphone. Ryan's car gets caught behind a blue speedster, then pass on the shoulder.
Move, bitch. He gets an EXTENDED PLAY and the screen flashes "NEW RECO Nearby, a KID watching the game nods.
Nice. The HIGH SCORE starts rising to match Ryan's score.
Get that? Ryan turns around to see Chad has shoved the cellphone do the front of his tattered shorts. And he's freeballing it
Check it; Attack of the Bubblegum Monster in Hi-Def videostream-
C'mon Chad, I gotta put my mouth on that. Holding a cup of soda between his teeth, Chad pulls the cellphone out of his pants and hits "SEND".
(through cup-holding teeth)
Sweet. It's going to my email right now. S9me soda inadvertently SPILLS onto the cellphone and Cha wipes it dry on his pants.
Watch it dude, I gotta return that thing in seven days.
They aren't giving you shit yet?

Nah, whenever I return it, I just list off why the phone sucks and they give me a new model. Figure by the tenth time I'll have to go somewhere else. Ryan's car finally CRASHES in a wall of flames.       Gam
As seen looking over the rail of the pier.      The tide but it's still a forty foot drop. RYAN stares over the railing like a death row inmate contemplating his last meal. CHAD
Go already. No one's looking. His left hand holds his WALLET.
(re: wallet) Need me to hold that? Ryan sticks it in the pocket of his surfer shorts -- he z a zipper, tucks a Velcro flap. Pats his pocket proudly. RYAN
Waterproof. But as soon as Ryan covertly CLIMBS ONTO THE RAIL, his le leg starts trembling like crazy. RYAN (CONT'D)
This is stupid. I could get killed. Pick another dare. Chad lowers the phone, irritated. CHAD
My ass. Not after you made me march in the Gay Pride Parade wearing a thong. RYAN
Screw it then. In one... Two... Two and a half-- CHAD
Whole numbers only, Rabbitfoot. Ryan stares at the waves crashing below. His leg starts snaking like crazy... And he chickens out, hopping back t the deck. CHAD (CONT'D)
Just so you know, I'm emailing this to every chick you ever met. But suddenly Ryan's oblivious to the dare.   His eyes are glued to something else--

(speaking like HAL 900) Transmitting pussy file now. CHLOE, early 20s, a head turner, confident, funny; she ca pull you in like a tractor beam. She and some CUTE FRIEND carry heavy cardboard boxes toward a table set up for the "Heal The Bay" rally. Ryan walks over like he owns the place. RYAN
Got any more? I'm here to help. CHLOE
Thanks, but no, we got 'em all. RYAN
What's in 'em? Chloe opens the box.    Hands him a "Heal The Bay" pamphl RYAN (CONT'D)
Cool, you're handing these out during the concert? CHLOE
Yeah, wanna help? Ryan tries to ignore his thundering heart.
Hell yeah.     I'm all about "Heal the Bay. " His eyes ricochet off the pamphlet in his hand. RYAN (CONT'D)

Me an Chad do the monthly cleanup thing, of course... An awesome wing-man, Chad appears over Chloe's shoulder, pretending to read a pamphlet, but really holding it up s Ryan can see it. Piece of cake, now. RYAN (CONT'D)
We've collected water samples with the Stream Team, raised money on the Promenade... I'm surprised I haven't seen you. He offers his hand.
Ryan. She takes it.
Chloe. The handshake lingers a second longer than necessary, and they both smile at each other. Chad splits. CHLOE (CONT'D)
I can't tell if you're full of it. Ryan stops posturing, gets real. RYAN
You ever go up to Santa Barbara? My dad used to take me there all RYAN (CONT'D)
the time. Their pier is amazing, clear water, huge crabs everywhere, oysters right there on the rocks, starfish... Hard to believe it's the same ocean sometimes. He's managed to win her back. CHLOE
Maybe you and I can take a break later when Pat Benatar goes on. RYAN
Sounds like a plan. There's a moment...     Then -- CHLOE
Oh no -- I forgot. I still have to pick up a box of T-shirts at the Kinkos on Venice. RYAN
I'll do it for you... if you want. CHLOE
Seriously, you would?
Sure.     How much is the bill?
Nothing.    It's been paid up front. RYAN
Do you promise not to go anywhere?
Done. Ryan makes a graceful exit.       Turns back. RYAN
Okay, I won't be long.
(laughing) Bye. Ryan grabs Chad, and as they walk out of earshot: RYAN
Dude, does Santa Barbara have a harbor or a pier?

A short time later, Ryan cruises through a Venice neighborhood. Ryan drives an early 70's Ford Bronco; clothes are strewn across the backseat, and a box of "Heal the Bay" T-SHIRTS sits on the shotgun seat. Ryan reaches into the glove box and pulls out a toothbrus He sips warm soda from a bottle and begins brushing. Checking himself out in the mirror, he sniffs his pits, w and grabs the cellphone. RYAN

(into phone) Dex, wassup? You won't believe the hotties I just met at the pier. Smoking. You wanna meet them? Yeah? Well don't get too excited 'cause I need my money. Ryan stops at a red light. RYAN (CONT'D)

Bullshit, you're not going anywhere, (quickly adding) I'm pulling up right now. Some AMBULANCES SPEED BY, SIRENS BLARING.   It's deafenin Ryan lays on the horn.   When the light changes, Ryan pee away angrily. RYAN (CONT'D)

(covering his ear) What? Yeah, you better be. And I need your shower, I'm talkin' code red stankage- The CELLPHONE begins to CRACKLE with STATIC just as Ryan drives under an OVERPASS. Suddenly -- The car ahead of him STOPS in the middle of the street. R notices too late and has to jam on the brakes. The car skids, he SCREAMS... and comes to a stop an inch before hitting the other car's bumper. He lifts the phone receiver to his ear but the call is WA WITH STATIC.
(into phone) Dex? You still there...? And as has happened to all of us, he loses the call. RYAN (CONT'D)
Damn.
As traffic resumes and Ryan clears the overpass--
Ryan picks up the phone.
Sorry, got cut off.      Hey -- what's my Caller ID say? But there's no voice on the other end, only shuffling sou
Yo Dex...?

12   Their insulation picked off and spliced together. PA the attic floor, past the rubble of the shattered phone, foll9wing the crudely repaired wires to JESSICA'S HANDS, tapping the dialer wires together. She's trying so hard t simulate a NUMERIC PULSE that she almost doesn't hear:
Hello...? Jessica's hands go suddenly still, then -- WHOOM! -- her slams down INTO FRAME on top of the crushed earpiece, a desperate hope filling her eyes.
With still no answer, Ryan pulls the phone from his ear -
Whatever.    Signing off- -- and is just about to hit END CALL when he hears a tiny female voice on the other end.
Wait!    Don't hang up! Ryan puts the phone back to his ear.
Hello?
There's not much time! I need you to go to the police. My name is Jessica Martin; I've been kidnapped!
(not buying)
Oh really? Kidnapped, huh? 13
Please. I know what you're thinking, but it's real! I'm in an attic somewhere. I think they're going to kill me! You need to-
Awfully polite kidnappers to give you a phone...
Jessica's voice TREMBLES uncontrollably.        Desperate and frustrated.
No!   You don't understand!
Suddenly, the cellphone BLIPS twice in Ryan's ear. it away and looks at its faceplate.
The LCD reads:     CALL WAITING.   ACCEPT?
If you were really in trouble, you would've called the cops, not me. Now I've got a real call on the other line--
A WIDER SHOT so we see Jessica's bound hands. Her bruised face. Whispering frantically into the DEMOLISHED TELEPHON she's JERI-RIGGING back together as she talks.

Goddamn it, listen to me! The phone I'm on...it's shattered! There's no dialer! I've been clicking wires together for hours trying to get someone, anyone, and you 're the only connection I was able to make! (important beat) If you hang up, I may not get anyone else.
SFX: Ryan's call waiting BLIPS again.        He considers everything Jessica has said, then:
Hmm. Sucks to be you. Try crank yanking someone else. Late.
Wait!     Don't hang up!    DON'T HANG UP!!
But -- CLICK!       Ryan flashes over to the next call.
Dex?
A TELEMARKETER checks Ryan's name on a list, then glances the script.
Hello, Mr. Ackerman. My name is Mark and I'd like to discuss with you the benefits of Mastercharge Credit Union's-
Awesome, I can totally use a credit card. Tell me more.
Absolutely.     We've lowered our APR-
-Shucks, now's really not a good time, but why don't I get your number and get back to you later.
Sure, it's 818...
That's the office number?
Yes.
Why don't you give me your number instead. That way I can call you when you're having dinner with your family. A beat.
Sorry to have bothered you. Click!    The Telemarketer hangs up.
Damn skippy. And that's when he notices the message flashing on the phone's faceplate: CALL ON HOLD. Ryan clicks the FLASH button to pick it up...and Jessica is still there.
JESSICA (VO)
--an you hear me?! RYAN
You still there? You're getting kinda creepy, lady. See ya.

No!    Don't! They're going to kill me!    They're going to kill me!! A silent beat.   A calculated look in her eyes... RYAN pulls the phone from his ear and is about to hang up...when he hears the one sound that stops all men cold. On the other end, Jessica begins to CRY. RYAN
Oh, it's like that, huh?     Nice with the fake tears, lady... JESSICA
Please...   I just need help. But Ryan won't be manipulated. RYAN
You need acting lessons. Now go take your meds and bug someone else. JESSICA
These men!!!-- Jessica stops herself short, quieting the rising hysteria her voice before it gives her away. She glances anxiously the attic door, then continues, more in control. JESSICA (CONT'D)
These men killed my housekeeper. My dog. You have to help me. Ryan bristles at being saddled with anything, much less t RYAN
No, actually( I don't. Not with a hot chick waiting for me at the pier. JESSICA
Please...you're my only hope. (beat) What's your name? That catches Ryan off-guard.   He stalls, not wanting to this personal. RYAN
Why, you writing a book--? 19
--Please, just tell me your name! Ryan glances around the street, his eyes falling on a sto fountain outside a French Restaurant.
Uh...Johnny. Johnny Fountain.
Johnny... What if it was your mother who was calling for help? How would you feel?
Well, I'd be damn impressed, considering she's dead.
Goddamn it, how difficult is it to hand this phone off to the police?! I'll pay you!
How much?
Five thousand dollars.
Sure you will. I'm hanging up now.
No, wait! WAIT!! Even if there's a eighty percent chance I'm lying, you nave a one in five chance to make five grand f9r a lousy twenty minutes of your life. (panics as Ryan is silent)
Haven't you ever bet on a horse or bought a Lottery ticket? I'm talking one-in-five odds, twenty minutes. Ryan slaps the radio off.
What do you want me to do?

In EXTREME SLOW-MOTION, chaos unfolds around us like a nightmare -- OFFICERS manhandle a drunk toward the back, a HOOKER scre at us with unholy rage, in the far corner, a JUNKIE spits 20 an OFFICER'S FACE and there's a lethal race for disinfect through invisible soup. Sounds are distant, eerily muffled.      A HIGH-PITCHED W lets us know we're in hell. CLOSE UP:    BOB MOONEY'S EYES.    Concerned, but not pan MOONEY'S POV. Still surreal, SLOW-MOTION, as an Officer w a CREWCUT responds by spinning the Junkie's face into a w legal but hard. SFX:   A HEARTBEAT.    OURS.    FAST... And possibly IRRE CLOSE UP - SLOW MOTION - The RIGHT THUMB presses into the LEFT WRIST. MOONEY'S EYES.      Watching.   Counting... Suddenly -- WHAM!! Back to reality when a YOUNG GANGBANGER is slammed into the station desk by a ROOKIE.
Problem, Mooney. If I put this one in with the others, there's gonna be a bloodbath.

Put me in there! I'll waste all them pussies! REVEAL SERGEANT BOB MOONEY -- a tough, fifty-something be cop who's fighting growing old every step of the way. He rolls his eyes at the situation and takes a bite of PIZZA

Come on Powell, put the Sharks with the Sharks, the Jets with the Jets and make room. Rookie Powell suppresses his irritation and roughly yanks Gangbanger back over to the holding cells. Mooney puts down the pizza, no appetite, and stares at th news story playing on the TV mounted in the corner.
a NEWS REPORTER is in the middle of a segment. Over him, FOOTAGE rolls of six guilty-looking cops testifying in co being led away in handcuffs.

...was somber when the indictments came down this afternoon in the 23rd Precinct corruption scandal. Though the names of six police officers were read aloud, the District Attorney stated that this was merely the "tip of the iceberg" and that unfortunately many other arrests are likely to be coming as the investigations proceed.
As DETECTIVE JACK TOMLIN passes Mooney, he nods toward th
Sucks for the fellas at the Two- Three right now, huh?
Dirty pricks deserve what they get. Public hates us enough without this shit. DETECTIVE TOMLIN
(leaving) There's good men over there. A FEMALE OFFICER passes Mooney and reaches for his box of pizza.
Mooney? What are you doing?      You can't be eating this crap. Mooney plants his own firm grip on the box.
Keep walking, Shelly.   Nothing to see here. A friendly tug of war.
You sure you wanna do that?     What would your wife say? That's it. Mooney snatches his lunch back and turns to lecture this little girl.

She'd say nothing, 'cause she's not gonna know about it! Christ, Shel, my old man had eleven heart attacks. Eleven! I have one little infarction and you guys start treating me like an invalid! I'm a grown man! Leave me alone, will you?!
(abashed)

I was merely referring to your cottage-cheese ass. Mooney sighs and lifts his pizza to his mouth when -- WHAMM! The station doors burst open and two dozen GANG MEMBERS are bum-rushed into the room by a squad of COPS i riot gear. The screaming is deafening.
I hate this place.
The Ford Bronco roars up; snags the handicapped spot. Rya hops out and limps theatrically the first few steps until he's far enough away from the car to start running.
(into phone)
I'm here.

Cops try to wrangle the dozens of shouting GANG MEMBERS w cram the Station Desk, waiting to be booked. Ryan takes a deep breath and shoves his way through the mayhem to the extremely shorthanded Station Desk where:
is busy doing ten things at once. Signing release papers. Booking a DRUNK whose wife-beater Tee is drenched in bloo Etc.
Excuse me, officer -- But Mooney ignores him in favor of the three cops that suddenly need arrest sheets signed.
Hey, I've got an emergency here -- Just then, CREWCUT OFFICER shoulders his way through with cuffed CRACKHEAD TRANNIE in tow. The Trannie's wrists ach
Loosen these, man, please?! Jus' gimme a chance--
Hey, Moon! Where do you want me to put Whitney Houston?
Christ, I've only got two hands here! Stick him in the can, will ya? Crewcut nods and moves off towards the bathroom.
(shoving forward)
Come on, man! I've got some lady on the phone here who says she's been kidnapped!
24 Ryan holds up the phone.         Mooney looks around.
Nice try, kid, but I got no time for pranks.
Seriously, a lady was murdered!
Which is it, a kidnapping or a murder?
Take the phone and find out moron! A COP snickers somewhere.
Jessica holds her breath. She stares apprehensively at th attic door, praying for Mooney to just take the damn phon
Please. . .
Ryan looks sincere.     Mooney deliberates, then sighs.
Okay.   Give it here. Ryan thrusts the phone at him, happy to get rid of it.
(barely audible whisper)

Oh thank God! You've got to help me. My name's Jessica Martin and I've been kidnapped. This morning five men broke into my home in Brentwood and kidnapped-- Mooney strains to hear.     His eyes go wide and he quick notes on a pad. Mooney's eyes shift as three TWEAKERS, wide eyed and swea profusely, are led inside by their ARRESTING OFFICERS.
Ah shit. Mooney holds out the phone.
Hurry kid, take this upstairs to Robbery/Homicide and ask for Detective Tomlin.
26 Ryan reluctantly takes the phone back as more people conv on the Station Desk.
Jessica hears the phone being shuffled around.
Where?
Hello?    Officer? Hello?!
Mooney, recognizing an emergency when he hears one, ignor the incoming CROWD him long enough to assist Ryan.
Up the stairs, Tomlin! Ryan turns away, and as he returns the cellphone to his e he's startled to hear-- JESSICA (VO)
(terrified) Oh my God...
What? What is it?
Jessica hears: SFX: FOOTSTEPS.     RIGHT OUTSIDE HER DOOR.

Lady, what's going on?! Jessica drops the phone. Has just enough time to shove it behind her before -- SLAM! -- the attic door swings open two of the masked kidnappers stride in. When they reach h they stand silently, trying to unnerve her.
Where's your husband?

What?     I don't- The masked leader SLAPS HER SHARPLY across the face! Jess wants to collapse to the ground, but remains sitting TO K THE PHONE HIDDEN behind her. The Leader bends down and yells right in her face.
Where is he!?
At work!     Why, what do you want--? SLAP!!!   This one's even nastier than the first.
Phone to his ear. Wide-eyed. Hearing it all.         For time, starting to believe Jessica's story.
Oh shit... Panicking, Ryan turns and walks, then jogs, then all-out for the station stairwell.
-v The Lead Kidnapper stands ominously over the trembling Jessica -- Oh God! Does he see the phone cord?
Please, he should be at work! That's all I know. The Leader nods, then turns away. Jessica exhales with relief that he didn't spot the phone. But her victory is short-lived as:
You have a little boy, right? Ricky? The Wyman School in Westwood? Jessica gasps like a sledgehammer just hit her in the che
But -- the men silently head out the door -- SLAM! locks. Jessica scrambles back to the phone.
Johnny!!
I know.    I'm trying to get help.
My son -- Suddenly, as Ryan reaches the first landing -- STATIC sta breaking up the call. JESSICA (CONT'D)
(worried) Oh my God! What's happening?!
It's just static. I'm running upstairs to the detectives. Hold on, I might lose you for a sec--
(realizing)
No, don't! Stop. You can't lose me--
(still running)
Wait, we're almost there.
(panics, losing her cool)
Stop! Johnny, goddamn it, stop!
Hearing her fearful tone, Ryan stops reluctantly.
Well, what the hell am I supposed to do?! Ryan looks at himself, standing on the stairs like an idi
Jesus!   I'm almost there! Ryan checks the SIGNAL STRENGTH INDICATOR on the phone. There's only one bar left. Defiantly, Ryan takes a step UP...and the bar DISAPPEARS. He quickly hops BACK DOWN.
Crap! (shouts up stairs)

text: There's no response.   Ryan can't believe this.
You're shitting me.
Johnny, what time is it?! Johnny!
(checking his watch) Who? Oh -- one-twenty. (MORE)
32 RYAN (CONT'D)
(yells upstairs)
Jessica calms herself, resolving to save her child's life
Johnny, listen to me. My son's school lets out at 1:45.
Good, then if I get a cop-- Ryan exits the stairwell to find Mooney -- but Mooney's n there anymore! There's some NEW GUY -- and he's SWAMPED!
No. There's not enough time. You have to pick him up before they--
Pick him up? Hell no, lady!     I ain't goin' nowhere else-- Ryan tries to get the NEW GUY's attention, in a dream.
Please please stop standing there! He 's just a little boy!
But I'm in a police station!
Go! Ryan grunts in frustration.
ECU - THE FORD BRONCO'S TIRES -- Burning rubber...
The furniture in this abandoned house is all covered with sheets giving the entire place a creepy, haunted feel. FOLLOW the LEAD KIDNAPPER as he descends a nearby stairwe and pulls off his mask--
Forties, salt and pepper hair.    He looks to his crew:
34 They're all trim. Athletic. In good shape. They're UNMASKED, watching the TV with interest. The news on the corruption scandal. Greer snaps the TV off.     Checks his watch and nods gri

Go get the kid. Instantly, a hulk of a man (DEASON) and an arrogant, red- headed prick (ELLIS) stand and exit the house. As Greer stalks away( BOOM DOWN the bar to REVEAL a telep sitting there, unnoticed by the men -- and on its face, t LINE-IN-USE INDICATOR LIGHT is lit. PUSH IN on the flashing orange light that threatens to gi Ryan and Jessica's call away. Closer and closer, until we ENTER the phone and TRAVEL THROUGH THE WIRES to --

text: As we PULL BACK we see that we're in the Ford Bronco, rac through:
Ryan guns the engine as Jessica panics on the other end o the phone. We can hear her hyperventilating.
Where are you now?!
I just got off the 405.
You've got to go faster, Johnny!
You've gotta chill! You're stressing the crap out of me! (looking around)
Where the hell is a cop hiding in a speed trap when you need one? Ryan takes a hard right, tires squealing.    Pushing it a his better judgment.
What do these guys want, anyway?
How should I know?!
What do you do?
I'm an obstetrician. They don't want anything from me.
36 Ryan slaloms around other cars like a racecar driver.
So your husband's like, uber-rich?
What--? No. He's an accountant. I make more money than he does.
Could they've mistaken you for someone else?
No! I don't know.    None of this makes any sense. Jessica starts losing it completely, upsetting Ryan so mu that he takes the next corner too fast and -- SKKRRASH! -
The BRONCO EXPLODES through an orange-and-white "ROAD CLO
And dead ahead is a CONSTRUCTION CREW resurfacing the roa

Oh...SHIT!! Ryan SLAMS on the brakes and SWERVES to avoid hitting a g of workers -- and OBLITERATES THE BRONCO'S PASSENGER SIDE MIRROR against another BARRIER -- Ryan cringes with every muscle! And the mirror ricochets off the ground -- and smashes through the windshield of a recently waxed Acura Legend! RYAN (CONT'D)

(smirking) ...Ain't that a bitch. As the heavily-muscled workers start running to beat the out of him, Ryan floors the gas, sending a shower of wet asphalt all over the cursing workers as he peels away, CRASHING through a FINAL BARRIER. More cautiously, Ryan rounds the next corner and --
There's the school. Ryan's right.   Just ahead, we see:
private prep school for boys. Ryan pull: A private prep it. Walks quickly toward the building.    school for pulls over and hops out,
Okay, I'm here.
How much time do we have? Ryan checks his watch.     It reads:   "1:40 PM".   He en
Five minutes. What's your kid's name?
Ricky.
Ricky what?
Martin.
Ricky Martin? You named your kid Ricky Martin?! Why didn't you tattoo "kick me" on his ass while you were at it?
He was named before the singer ever-
Forget it.     What does he look like?
He's eight years old. Blonde hair. Green eyes. Small for his age. He's wearing a light blue shirt and dark blue pants--

They're all wearing blue shirts and pants! Ryan turns down a hallway and we see that he's right. filled with IDENTICALLY-UNIFORMED LITTLE BOYS. As a TIMID BLONDE BOY passes in front of him, Ryan grabs and wheels him around.
Ricky Martin? The Boy's eyes get huge.     He tries to pull away.
Don't touch me!
No, kid, it's okay!    I didn't mean to--
Help!   Don't touch me!   Don't touch!! Ryan quickly moves on... aware that other ADULTS are now beginning to take notice of him.
Does he have anything else? A jacket? A backpack? What's his lunch box look like?
I don't remember.
You don't remember your own kid's lunch box?!
I don't pack it! Rosario, our housekeeper does! Sometimes Craig, but... Jessica begins to sob, which causes Ryan to panic further
Ricky Martin, where are you!? None of the Stepford kids respond. JESSICA (VO)
(through tears) I wish I could give you more. Now Ryan's running.    He yells into a BATHROOM.
Ricky Martin?
Can I help you, sir? Ryan turns to see a MUSCULAR GYM TEACHER looming there. Clearly, the guy thinks Ryan's peeping into the boys' roo
I'm looking for a little blond boy-- (off his shocked look)
--No, no! Not like that!

mmmrrmph mrm mrmph! Ryan is bounced around like a corn kernel in a popper unt the car hits a jutting rock and -- WHOOOOM! -- goes up on wheels. It looks like it's going to roll but gravity brin

One.. .

Thre--

listening to the call with every fiber of his being.

But Greer isn't listening to her. He strides back into th room, listening to the noise under her voice.

I'm here.

(welling up with tears)

It's suicide. They'll kill me!
77 J...      JESSICA

Jessica Kate Martin? The Woman nods. Mooney is plainly disillusioned by the woman. Maybe his hunch was wrong...

Mooney. (shakes his head)

walks back into the house and flips open her CELLPHONE. W she finishes dialing, a familiar DEEP MALE VOICE answers.
Hello?

Well, I've got an itch that needs scatching.
Too close to make out who it is just yet--
What's the problem?
We're in the middle of a shit storm, and I need you to put a leash put on an officer.
Who?
An Officer Mooney from your division. Know him? Now, we start PULLING BACK, revealing the man's features.
Mooney? He's a desk sergeant.      What would you want with him?
I had to do a B & E and he came snooping around the house looking for the owner.
And what did you say?
That I was her, of course. Continue PULLING BACK.   We can almost recognize him now.
Did he believe you?
I think so. He said he thought someone was pulling a prank on him.
Mooney doing an investigation? What's are you really up to? The man swivels around in his chair and we see clearly it

Sorry.   I just...

For what I've done...   For giving up Craig... Ryan is moved by the emotion in her voice.
Jessica, they have your kid. You had no choice.
I don't know. I don't know...

Ryan finally makes it to shore; coughing, retching. He cr up the sand, out of breath, blood trailing behind him. He unzips the waterproof pocket of his shorts, pulling ou the cellphone, which thank God is actually dry. Ryan forc himself into action; stumbling, exhausted into a --

The place is dark. Empty. An array of rowing shells cover in ghostly, flapping tarps make the place look vaguely ha This place is also filled with storage equipment, such as buoys and safety netting used by the beach patrol.
TOMLIN - racing through the sand under the pier. He spots Ryan's bloody footprints and follows them toward the --

(to himself)
Think! Think!
Chloe hands Mooney a cup of water and frantically looks around for the paramedics. Mooney starts rising to his fe

And as he stumbles off--

You're wounded kid, just give me what I came for, and I'll let you all go. Police sirens in the distance grow louder. Tomlin's offer goes unanswered.    That's when he notices BLOOD on the ground. Tomlin smiles, following Ryan's trai to a PILE OF BLOOD-SMEARED TARPS -- where the trail ends! It's obvious Ryan used these to staunch his wound. Shit! He's gonna have to search this whole place-- Then, suddenly, Tomlin gets an idea. He pulls out his pho making sure it's concealed from view, and writes a TEXT MESSAGE to-- x95   EXT. SANTA MONICA PIER - NIGHT Greer pulls out his ringing cell phone. On the text scree it says, "CALL HIM". Greer flashes an wicked grin, and di the last number on his call log.

Tomlin's ready to pounce. Shoulda stayed at home this morning, kid. And just then, Tomlin throws off the shredded tarp exposi Ryan's cellphone.   And nothing else.

Ryan, looking like a psychotic Babe Ruth, gi Tomlin two more vicious WHACKS before grabbing his cellph and high-tailing it out of there.

Got him.   He's in the parking lot.

RUN!

""Freeze! Drop your weapon! Ellis quickly swings his rifle and-- BAM! Mooney shoots Ellis in the head, causing him to slid off the carousel roof.

No more bullshit!     Just give me the goddamn disc! Ryan slowly unzips his front jacket pocket and removes th DVD. Greer snatches it and SMASHES it to pieces. Fragments fal through the cracks in the pier, to the ocean below. Ryan, pale as ghost, knows he's seconds from meeting his maker.

This is about to be the most enjoyable part of an extremely shitty day. And just as he's about to pull the trigger -- BLAM!! Jessica fires a WARNING SHOT. Greer( startled, spi around to see Jessica pointing Hodges' gun in his face.

Tell me why I shouldn't kill you. For the first time, Greer actually looks frightened. Recognizing the homicidal look in her eyes, he SPUTTERS, nothing comes out. Ryan, weak and pale with blood loss, looks up at his guar angel.

As the cops move in and drag Greer to his feet, Ryan call out to him.
Hey man, your shitty day is about to get a whole lot shittier.
Ryan flips open his phone and on the SCREEN plays the SECURITY FOOTAGE of the murder in the parking lot. We see that Ryan must've copied the DVD with his videophone.
Ain't that a bitch?
And through the tears, Jessica manages a laugh. A small o But enough to let us know everything's going to be okay. as we PULL BACK on the scene--

Craig's very weak, but the doctors say it looks promising. He's probably going to have to walk with a cane, but that's the worst of it... I'm just thankful. Chloe senses that Jessica and Ryan might need a moment al

I can't believe I almost lost everything that means... I don't know how I can ever thank you.

Don't ever call me again. A shared laugh, then as they turn to the television--
